segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: In the Great Hall of the Penteveral, fanning out through many seats are assembled students, researchers, faculty, staff. Hushed noises, paper fluttering, familiars getting into their places in the rafters. A dwarven woman ascends a small series of steps to a lectern looking out over the Great Hall. Here, where some of the greatest lessons in the Penteveral's history have been given.
segments.summary: Opening scene in the Great Hall of the Penteveral during Dean Kora's inauguration

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Dean Kora Keplenvaisreck, her platinum blonde hair sculpted as stonework around her head in rolls and beautiful array. Red lipstick, well done face, gown, ruff like a governess, looks out.
segments.summary: Description of Dean Kora's appearance

segments.speaker: Dean Kora Keplenvaisreck
segments.content: Today at my inauguration as dean of the Penteveral, it occurs to me to speak words of acknowledgement, kindness, and admiration for Dean Ellipides Tallbarrel.
segments.summary: Dean Kora begins her inauguration speech acknowledging her predecessor

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Applause goes up.
segments.summary: Audience applauds Dean Kora's speech

segments.speaker: Dean Kora Keplenvaisreck
segments.content: His term as the fourth dean of the Penteveral will always be remembered as when the beginning of a truly great era found its nascency. And as the fifth dean of the Penteveral, I'd like to talk about the number five.
segments.summary: Dean Kora continues her speech about being the fifth dean

segments.speaker: Marisha Ray
segments.content: Oh.
segments.summary: Marisha reacts to the speech

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We move-- In the back, we see--
segments.summary: Scene transition to show Murray in the back of the hall

segments.speaker: Marisha Ray
segments.content: Oh, where do we see Murray up to here at the Great Hall?
segments.summary: Marisha asks about Murray's position

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson
segments.content: I can't hear. I want to be able to use this against her later. Sorry. Excuse me.
segments.summary: Murray pushes forward to get a better seat

segments.speaker: Student
segments.content: Oh!
segments.summary: Student reacts to Murray pushing through

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson
segments.content: Sorry, sorry.
segments.summary: Murray apologizes while pushing through

segments.speaker: Student
segments.content: Highly irregular!
segments.summary: Student complains about Murray's behavior

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson
segments.content: That's my seat, sorry.
segments.summary: Murray claims a seat

segments.speaker: Student
segments.content: Sorry.
segments.summary: Student apologizes

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson
segments.content: Move.
segments.summary: Murray demands the student move

segments.speaker: Student
segments.content: There's open seats in the back!
segments.summary: Student protests about available seating

segments.speaker: Murray Mag'Nesson
segments.content: Shut up.
segments.summary: Murray tells the student to be quiet

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Across town at the Archanade, walking through beautiful marble halls, Bolaire Lathalia walks as the Lord Temoday Wurnst speaks to the Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray saying,
segments.summary: Scene shifts to the Archanade where Bolaire is with nobles

segments.speaker: Lord Temoday Wurnst
segments.content: Well, it's absolutely stunning, of course. I mean, the building itself is exemplary.
segments.summary: Lord Wurnst comments on the Archanade

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She keeps her eyes ever trained on you, Bolaire, marveling at Shay's Blade, the last of the Pariah Blades hanging in its place of honor here in the heart of the Lloy Wing.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray focuses on Bolaire and Shay's Blade

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: The sword that killed the first god to die in Aramán.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray describes Shay's Blade's significance

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Stunning, isn't it?
segments.summary: Bolaire comments on the blade

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: Remarkably mundane!
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray remarks on the blade's ordinary appearance

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Well, I suppose that was the whole point of it, really, bringing something mundane to something celestial, something beyond, one was inevitably going to triumph over the other. This is fake, of course.
segments.summary: Bolaire explains the philosophy behind the blade and reveals it's a fake

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: What?
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray reacts with surprise

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Oh, yes. We wouldn't leave anything that expensive and that rare out where anybody could touch it, break it.
segments.summary: Bolaire explains why they display a fake

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: Oh. Well, it's just, this beautiful exhibit all around it, it just seemed so real.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray comments on the convincing display

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Well, it's very close to real, but there's only one way to know if you could actually tell the difference. And for someone of your standing--
segments.summary: Bolaire hints at showing the real blade

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: How interesting.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray expresses interest

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Would you like to see the real one?
segments.summary: Bolaire offers to show the authentic blade

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: I very much would, Master Lathalia.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray accepts the offer

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: It's the least I can do after making you come back after everything ridiculous that went on last night.
segments.summary: Bolaire references previous night's events

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As she walks away, she smiles, nodding to you. Give me a persuasion check, if you'd be so kind.
segments.summary: DM calls for a persuasion check from Bolaire

segments.speaker: Taliesin Jaffe
segments.content: Hmm. Hmm. Really? Nine.
segments.summary: Taliesin rolls a 9 for persuasion

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: Your kindness in this regard is deeply appreciated. The Pariah Blades, you said celestial. Were they capable of harming celestials or only the gods themselves?
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray asks about the Pariah Blades' capabilities

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Well, no one really knows. I have my own theories and I do put them forward.
segments.summary: Bolaire admits uncertainty about the blades' full capabilities

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: By all means, Master Lathalia, put them forward.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray encourages Bolaire to share his theories

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: There's so much we don't know about-- Despite it only being 80, 90 years, not that long ago, there were battles that were barely seen, few survivors, and we have so little information about what actually happened. So much we don't know.
segments.summary: Bolaire discusses the lack of historical records from the god wars

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: It's a marvel you've recovered all of the blades.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray comments on the collection

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Well, it helps that we are funded by the family that made them.
segments.summary: Bolaire reveals the funding source

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: Delightful.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray responds positively

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: But yes, they are-- There's something about the weight of reality. I believe the weight of reality can crush most things.
segments.summary: Bolaire shares his theory about the blades' power

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: Well, it seems that much of the real has been gathered here in this place.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray observes the collection's significance

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Thank you.
segments.summary: Bolaire accepts the compliment

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: I would love to see some of this. And you have some of the other divine, or I should say, undivine weaponry here, yes?
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray asks about other divine weapons

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia
segments.content: Oh, they vary quite a bit in make and form.
segments.summary: Bolaire describes the variety of weapons

segments.speaker: Lady Amariya Dacen Cormoray
segments.content: Hmm.
segments.summary: Lady Cormoray acknowledges

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson
segments.content: this will probably be on the list. Stay tuned! It's going to be a lot of fun and you're not going to want to miss this.
segments.summary: Ashley promotes upcoming content

segments.speaker: Matt Mercer
segments.content: And folks, the first three episodes of The Mighty Nein are out right now on Prime Video. So if you missed our live launch party, you can now find the VOD on Beacon right now or Prime Video next week. But for those interested in more behind the scenes content we are super excited to announce mid-season and finale talk back shows titled "Inside 'The Mighty Nein'" these are 60-minute episodes that will be available on Prime Video starting December 3rd. Along with an extended 90-minute version that'll be exclusive to Beacon. These videos will explore the creative process behind adapting Campaign 2 to animation and it's truly been a labor of love from all of us and we're so excited for you all to finally see this series. Cannot wait.
segments.summary: Matt announces Mighty Nein animated series release and behind-the-scenes content

segments.speaker: Laura Bailey
segments.content: Oh no, and I have the hiccups. In case you missed it, our fourth annual Critmas Can't Miss Sale is running strong and Black Friday and Cyber Monday weekend is around the corner. So, guess what, there might be some additional savings on already marked down items Black Friday through Cyber Monday. But stock is limited, so if you have your eye on something, don't take too long because they could sell out. And that's it. I did it. I did it.
segments.summary: Laura promotes the Critmas sale despite having hiccups

segments.speaker: Matt Mercer
segments.content: The ENnie Award winning campaign setting "Dungeons of Drakkenheim" is coming to Daggerheart. Created by the wonderful Dungeon Dudes and Ghostfire Gaming, "Dungeons of Drakkenheim" is a dark fantasy cosmic horror sandbox campaign where adventurers explore a city devastated by a mysterious meteor shower and haunted by horrifying monsters. It's really cool, everybody, it's great, guys. The Daggerheart ruleset is a perfect fit for Drakkenheim's core themes of hope and fear offering a fresh way to explore the cursed city. So learn more and back it on Kickstarter at ghostfiregaming.com/drakkenheart. Seriously, check it out, it's awesome. I think that concludes our announcements. So let's go ahead and jump back into Aramán, back to you.
segments.summary: Matt announces Dungeons of Drakkenheim adaptation for Daggerheart

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hello and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role. I don't know why anyone's laughing because I'll tell you what's deadly serious. The combat we just had at the wraith tree! Folks, our Soldiers' table is on a mission for vengeance, searching for a man named Casimir Gavendale. Once a brother of the Torn Banner, fighting on the rebels' side of the Falconers' Rebellion, now seemingly having turned over the beloved Thjazi Fang, boon companion of one Thimble over to the Sundered Houses to meet his death at the end of the hangman's rope.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps the party's mission to find the traitorous Casimir Gavendale

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We have traveled north in pursuit of the treacherous Casimir Gavendale, but also perhaps more closely in need of rescuing one of his potential victims, that being Cyd, Talcydimir Pridesire, Teor's younger brother, pursuing his tracks out from Dol-Makjar after the events of Thjazi Fang's funeral and having put together the pieces of what went wrong in the attempt to save Thjazi's life, which was proven impossible to do.
segments.summary: The party pursues both Casimir and seeks to rescue Teor's brother Cyd

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We instead see here in these moments, where your footsteps have led you, following Cyd out of Dol-Makjar. He and Casimir splitting up, finding the gnomish arcanist, Ulbid Morn, a father of some long-lost heroes of the Falconers' Rebellion, who parted with a very capable enchanted toy sword, and against his knowledge, also parted with a knife, a beloved handle of lapis lazuli and ivory. The handle returned, but the blade itself unknowingly kept in the possession of one Kattigan Vale.
segments.summary: Recap of encountering Ulbid Morn and the enchanted items obtained

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your footsteps led you down from the fireworks and goat-protected walls of Ulbid's observatory, where he keeps an eye on the magical happenings of the Stormwrack, but also on travelings of the road, the banner of the king headed south, just as Casimir Gavendale, that worm, heads north! That son of a bitch! You killed our friend and he was your friend! That's the worst kind of killing my friend!
segments.summary: Brennan expresses anger at Casimir's betrayal while recapping their paths

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Traveling north. Cyd made his way through the forest, but on foot versus Casimir's carriages and through the dense forest against Casimir traveling on the King's Road. You have to wonder if Cyd, even if he makes it out of the Dahapshanee Wood, won't have a trap waiting for him on the other end of the forest, and indeed, it was that premonition within a crystal that Thimble saw.
segments.summary: Describes Cyd's dangerous journey through the forest and Thimble's vision

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You made your way to Hawthorn's Glade, found at the edge by Hawthorn herself and some of her glade's finest warriors. You were saved in the nick of time by none other than Wicander Halovar's unlikely summoning of the light! Wings of light surrounding.
segments.summary: Recap of arriving at Hawthorn's Glade and Wicander's divine intervention

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: We both have wings. We're the same.
segments.summary: Sam notes similarities between characters

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And you made an impression on Hawthorn. You made more than an impression on Shuffa, a shambling mound who appears to, with no central nervous system, still be possessed of a religious conviction in your sacredness. You saw the glade of fairies that have fled danger, and in some cases, it seems, persecution, perhaps even at the hands of the Candescent Creed, if that grasshopper fae can be believed.
segments.summary: Recap of meeting Shuffa and learning about fae persecution

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You also met Sallow, a hag who betrayed the secrecy of the glade to tell you that yes, Cyd not only was here, but had been sent to his death at the wraith's tree. A terrible plan, but one that the fae had made to keep their glade safe by feeding those mortals that had found their glade to the wraith, such that more undead would patrol the woods at night and keep people far from this place.
segments.summary: Recap of Sallow's betrayal and the fae's cruel plan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You made quick work of the wraith animated within the tree and even sending it back to the underworld with a divine smite. The tree began to summon it back before Thimble could douse it in Kattigan's oil and set it to light as the zombies disanimate all around you. It is to this moment we return, as fire fills the forest around you.
segments.summary: Recap of defeating the wraith and burning the tree

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Flickering fire as the tree goes up. It is bright as day here in the dark forest. This tree sputters, and though you do not actually believe it to be fundamentally supernatural, the oil of the dead tree pops and screams as the wood splits in the flame. The steam escapes and hisses with these loud, shrill cries. As you are surrounded by, in Tyranny's case, a kind of comforting hellfire, looking around, seeing the most freshly dead are indeed closest to the tree, you can breathe a sigh of relief that Cyd's body is nowhere to be found.
segments.summary: The burning tree creates a bright inferno with eerie sounds, but Cyd's body is not among the dead

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: As far as we can tell, I think so.
segments.summary: Teor confirms Cyd likely escaped

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: So, he made it.
segments.summary: Thimble expresses relief that Cyd survived

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: I run up to Wick. Oh my. You were so cool! You were so cool! What? Did you know you could do that?
segments.summary: Tyranny excitedly praises Wicander's divine display

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: I did not. No, I did not, but, I don't even know what that was. It could be that monster blood or whatever in me. I don't even know if that's good, or-- whatever.
segments.summary: Wicander is uncertain about his newfound powers and mentions monster blood

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Sounds really good to me. I don't know.
segments.summary: Tyranny reassures Wicander about his abilities

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Did you say monster blood?
segments.summary: Teor questions Wicander about the monster blood comment

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: Yes, the angel thing. It was, yes. I don't know, I don't know, I don't know. It remains to be seen, but if your brother isn't here, have we--
segments.summary: Wicander mentions the angel connection and redirects to finding Teor's brother

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Are any of the zombies fresh enough to be looted? Listen! Listen!
segments.summary: Thimble pragmatically asks about looting the zombie corpses

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What a absolutely marvelous question. Give me an investigation check.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for an investigation check for looting

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Whoa! That's a 22!
segments.summary: Thimble rolls a high investigation check

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 22, hell yes. I would like you to please, on a 22, we'll call it, starting at 10 and for every five above, we'll go 2d10, so give me 6d10. You find 38 gold pieces in several different denominations scattered throughout those people here. I'll even say it's probably, we call it 31 gold pieces. That's seven, and then call it, you know, 56 silver pieces, and then call it 104 copper pieces.
segments.summary: Brennan awards a substantial amount of treasure for the high roll

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I can't carry that. Somebody needs to.
segments.summary: Thimble notes she cannot carry all the found treasure

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So, you know, over, but this is, by the way, Thimble, this is going to be 20 minutes because each of these poachers, these are poachers and smugglers. As you look at those assembled and gathering out here, the terrible calculation of the fae, who are themselves, some of them are good, but not all of them, and even some of them that are not good didn't approve of this plan, but, you know, Hawthorn is a spirit of wild nature, maybe neither good nor evil. She sent a lot of people here to die, but you do look out here and see there is no neighborhood schoolchildren.
segments.summary: Brennan explains the moral complexity of the dead - mostly poachers and smugglers, not innocents

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: There's a lot of people that for one reason or another wanted to take deep into the Dahapshanee knowing how dangerous it was. You see a lot of people trying to find new smuggling tracks to get into and out of Dol-Makjar, but again, that describes a lot of people you're friends with. There's a lot of poachers, people that are coming here knowing it's a magical forest. You see that there's some people here also. You got a 22. Go ahead and roll a d100 for me.
segments.summary: The dead include many who knowingly entered dangerous territory, and Brennan calls for a d100 roll

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yeah, is anybody carrying some sawed-off satyr horns from our homie back in the glade that we can return? Punk-ass.
segments.summary: Teor sarcastically asks about returning stolen satyr horns

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.summary: Laura rolls a 90 on the d100

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 90. One second. Hells yes. On a particularly large, fearsome-looking hunter. First, you see this hunter. Looks sort of like wilderness man. He's got a couple of pelts around his shoulder from small animals. From the oil staining the pelts, you think it's probably either otter, or beaver, or some kind of, or maybe some kind of water rat pelts. You see he's got-- and then you see the tools that he carries on him are pretty fe
segments.summary: Brennan begins describing a special hunter among the dead with valuable equipment

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see a pair of horns on his belt. The horns don't seem to have any magical property other than that they are a horrifying visage of this man's evil work. You do, however, see that there are two small vials on his belt, each of which appears to be some kind of potion. As you open the thick leather harness, the belt, almost like a bandolier, many of them are empty, but two are actually buttoned, and undoing the clasps on them, light spreads out. You see two thick glass vials with a slightly luminous, helixing or lava-lamping gold and a pearlescent silvery white.
segments.summary: Thimble discovers two mysterious potions and fairy horns on the fairy hunter's body

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a nature check, if you'd be so kind.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yes!

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: You're good at that, right?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: But not right now I'm not good at it, but nine.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Anyone else that wants to take a crack at it can, especially if you have proficiency in nature.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: That's a 13. That was the one. 14.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think on scent alone, as Wulferic is here with you, you don't have a deeper insight, but you know that whatever that is, it is probably a potion made on the fly, which makes you think it's pretty close to being some kind of biological fluid of a magical creature. Blood, tears, something like that.
segments.summary: Kattigan identifies the potions as likely made from magical creature fluids

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: Drink it.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I give all my gold to Teor.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You can see that, oh, you give the gold to Teor? Under the armpits? In the purse.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So, you mark down these two mystery potions. You don't know exactly what they do, but I will say that for whatever it's worth, this guy had them on his belt, so in terms of if they do something, he clearly wanted quick access to them, right?
segments.summary: The party notes the potions were kept for quick access by the fairy hunter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And I think that you see this horrifying man, who you see, he has a lumpen, angry-looking face, even in death, partially rotted through the, he's probably been a zombie for at least a year at this point with the rot that's, you know, even animated through undeath, these guys still slowly decompose, but you don't sense this guy was pleasant to be around even when fully alive and unrotting.
segments.summary: Description of the fairy hunter's decomposed undead state

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I'm just going to take my pin sword and stab it in his eye.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see a little bit of putrescent filth oozes down his face. It is for this man that this policy was adopted by Hawthorn's Glade, and perhaps some of the dead here would blame the fairies, but maybe in some way, some blame should be reserved for men like this that make those choices necessary.
segments.summary: Thimble desecrates the fairy hunter's corpse, and Brennan reflects on how such evil men led to Hawthorn's Glade's policies

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: It is dead of night and as the tree, the tree will be burning for some time, and you also can't guarantee, thankfully this is a rainforest, so the death of these trees means that they are largely waterlogged still. You don't think there's a real chance of a fire spreading out through here, but I think that you can feel, Thimble, reaching out through the forest here. Something really horrifying and dangerous has died in this forest. You guys have, insofar as chasing Cyd, have rid the world of a deep and profound evil, but also made this forest more accessible for whoever wants to access it.
segments.summary: The Wraith Tree burns through the night in the rainforest, with Thimble sensing the death of great evil

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And the last piece of your looting is the two corroded bronze halves of that holy symbol that the wraith held, which you can see are withered, desiccated. It looks like that bronze symbol must have aged some centuries or whatever in the time that it fell to the ground. But you have that as well if you wish to carry it, though none would blame you if you did not.
segments.summary: The party finds the corroded holy symbol of Tansul

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Do you want to take it?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: I wouldn't mind, just because it's a relic of an old time.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Pick up the two halves and fly it over to him.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a religion check. You know it simply as a symbol of Tansul, who was the Shaper of the sun.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yeah, I'll hold on to it. And even though it's not seen in my character design, there are nifty-ass pouches under the underarms of my--

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Are there any freshies around? I'd like to just pop off a finger. I'm kind of hungry.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: You eat people?

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: He's dead! Yeah, I said it. I mean, I don't do it when we're back at your family's house, but it is something that I can and will do.

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Am I a little hungy? Yeah, we've been fighting. So I'd like to find one and get a little--

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: That's desecrating a dead body.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The last thing I'll say in terms, as you swallow this finger, there's obviously tons of other stuff here loot-wise, none of which is good as your current. Basically, scything through a bunch of mundane weapons, none of which are worth equipping.
segments.summary: Tyranny eats a finger while the party searches for more loot but finds nothing of value

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: If there is a random dagger, I'll take one just to have an extra dagger.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)

segments.content: Can I also ask, while we're doing that searching of the bodies. I would be trying to canvass in this battlefield and with the fire and all those things any sort of signs of Cyd. Flecks of fur or any kind of equipment that he might have dropped in order to flee quickly.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Under the sputtering of this massive bonfire in this Wraith Tree, which is sort of a funny thing to watch because it is a sacrilege of a sacrilege, so it feels, it's not like you're watching something that's pleasant or good, but there is a weird feeling of, I think, Tyranny, watching this tree burn, you feel a sort of demonic pleasure. This is sort of sacred to demons, the destruction of something worthy of destruction.

segments.speaker: Whitney
segments.content: Plus I feel like it's sort of when just a regular person looks at a campfire and you think, 'Oh, I am connected to every person who has ever watched a fire and been mesmerized.' segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I love it. You are not surrounded by aesthetics this pleasant back in Dol-Makjar. You could absolutely make an attempt right now. In the dark of night-- under the light of the Wraith Tree, it will be made with disadvantage, but I don't know if you guys want to camp out at the burning Wraith Tree, so.

segments.content: So this is the place you have to go through. I think on a 20 perception, you look around and you see a couple markers. As you guys head down through the trees, you see a couple things on a 20 that you would expect to see here. There are a couple very old trees that have rope tied around them. The rope has moss growing on it, and it's thick cable tied around trees many, many, many, many, many times. You can see that there are a number of little red threads, some of which have dropped, some of which have grown into the moss on the rope that have small little pewter or tin charms on them. The charms all always have two letters. For a lot of the crofters in Timmony that get married, they would come up and leave these tied to these fairy trees at the edge of the woods to basically ask for luck in their marriage.
segments.summary: The party discovers fairy trees with marriage charms left by crofters for luck

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see that a little bit further away from those trees that you can tell have been abandoned, you see there are some fence posts. you see there are some fence posts. The fence posts appear to have these long threads on them that have cowbells tied to either end of them. It's not a perfect solution by any means. But you see that a lot of the rope, these thinner cords, will have fences with natural geography that slope down towards a fixed point, and the thread will go across that because they don't expect the things coming out of the woods to be worried about traps. Basically, where is natural gravity going to make a shambling thing come and hit a thing to make a cowbell go off on the hillside for us to hear that we all need to run, or get out of here. That's what you see on that perception check.
